Body:
I'm using the Adafruit Feather 32u4 RFM95 Lora Radio as the MCU for a remote sensor and switch. I am using the RadioHead library to interface with the radio module.

My goal is to have my Feather send sensor data at regular intervals. I also want it to be able to receive commands remotely which switch attached devices on and off. I have it connected to a battery and a solar panel. The solution I have so far is this

void loop()	{		    if (rf95.available())	    {   	        handleRFInput();	    }		    unsigned long currentMillis = millis();	    if (currentMillis - previousMillis >= TIME_BETWEEN_PACKETS)	    {	        // Sends the data	        sendSensorData();		        // save the last time data was sent	        previousMillis = currentMillis;	    }	}

There are a few problems with this. The first, and biggest, problem is that I can easily lose incoming data. The second is that the processor is always running and I can't make it sleep with the fear of losing incoming messages. I'd like to preserve as much power as possible by letting it sleep for as long as possible.

The obvious solution for this problem is having an interrupt fire when a new message is available. I can't figure out how to do this. There is a pin, #7, in the documentation that says it is an IRQ. I tried 

#define RFM95_INT 7		attachInterrupt(digitalPinToInterrupt(RFM95_INT)
column10:
CHANGE);

but when I ran it nothing happened. No sensor data was transmitted or anything. What do I need to do to be able to get an interrupt when a message arrives?
